gobblin.aws

Class AWSSdkClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.aws.AWSSdkClient

  • @Alpha
public class AWSSdkClient
extends Object
    Class responsible for all AWS API calls.

    This class makes use of AWS SDK API and provides clients for various Amazon AWS services such as: EC2, S3, AutoScaling; as well as this class provides various helper methods to perform AWS service API calls.

      • addPermissionsToSecurityGroup

        public void addPermissionsToSecurityGroup(String groupName,
                                          String ipRanges,
                                          String ipProtocol,
                                          Integer fromPort,
                                          Integer toPort)
        Open firewall for a security group
        Parameters:
        groupName - Open firewall for this security group
        ipRanges - Open firewall for this IP range
        ipProtocol - Open firewall for this protocol type (eg. tcp, udp)
        fromPort - Open firewall for port range starting at this port
        toPort - Open firewall for port range ending at this port

        public String createKeyValuePair(String keyName)
        Creates a 2048-bit RSA key pair with the specified name
        Parameters:
        keyName - Key name to use
        Returns:
        Unencrypted PEM encoded PKCS#8 private key

      • createLaunchConfig

        public void createLaunchConfig(String launchConfigName,
                               String imageId,
                               String instanceType,
                               String keyName,
                               String securityGroups,
                               com.google.common.base.Optional<String> kernelId,
                               com.google.common.base.Optional<String> ramdiskId,
                               com.google.common.base.Optional<com.amazonaws.services.autoscaling.model.BlockDeviceMapping> blockDeviceMapping,
                               com.google.common.base.Optional<String> iamInstanceProfile,
                               com.google.common.base.Optional<com.amazonaws.services.autoscaling.model.InstanceMonitoring> instanceMonitoring,
                               String userData)
        Create a launch configuration that can be later used to create AmazonAutoScaling groups
        Parameters:
        launchConfigName - Desired launch config name
        imageId - AMI image id to use
        instanceType - EC2 instance type to use
        keyName - Key name
        securityGroups - Security groups to apply
        kernelId - Optional kernel id
        ramdiskId - Optional ram disk id
        blockDeviceMapping - Optional EBS device mapping
        iamInstanceProfile - Optional IAM instance profile
        instanceMonitoring - Optional instance monitoring
        userData - User data (eg. shell script to execute at instance boot under this launch config)

      • deleteLaunchConfiguration

        public void deleteLaunchConfiguration(String launchConfigName)
        Delete a launch configuration by its name
        Parameters:
        launchConfigName - Name of launch config to delete

      • createAutoScalingGroup

        public void createAutoScalingGroup(String groupName,
                                   String launchConfig,
                                   Integer minSize,
                                   Integer maxSize,
                                   Integer desiredCapacity,
                                   com.google.common.base.Optional<String> availabilityZones,
                                   com.google.common.base.Optional<Integer> cooldown,
                                   com.google.common.base.Optional<Integer> healthCheckGracePeriod,
                                   com.google.common.base.Optional<String> healthCheckType,
                                   com.google.common.base.Optional<String> loadBalancer,
                                   com.google.common.base.Optional<String> terminationPolicy,
                                   List<com.amazonaws.services.autoscaling.model.Tag> tags)
        Create and launch an AmazonAutoScaling group
        Parameters:
        groupName - Auto scaling group name
        launchConfig - Launch configuration string
        minSize - Minimum number of instances to maintain in auto scaling group
        maxSize - Maximum number of instances to scale up-to for load
        desiredCapacity - Desired number of instances to maintain in auto scaling group
        availabilityZones - Optional availability zones to make use of
        cooldown - Optional cooldown period before any scaling event (default is 300 secs)
        healthCheckGracePeriod - Optional grace period till which no health check is performed after bootup (default is 300 secs)
        healthCheckType - Optional health check type (default is EC2 instance check)
        loadBalancer - Optional load balancer to use
        terminationPolicy - Optional termination policies
        tags - Optional tags to set on auto scaling group (they are set to propagate to EC2 instances implicitly)

      • deleteAutoScalingGroup

        public void deleteAutoScalingGroup(String autoScalingGroupName,
                                   boolean shouldForceDelete)
        Delete an auto scaling group by its name
        Parameters:
        autoScalingGroupName - Name of auto scaling group to delete
        shouldForceDelete - If the AutoScalingGroup should be deleted without waiting for instances to terminate

      • getAutoScalingGroupsWithTag

        public List<com.amazonaws.services.autoscaling.model.AutoScalingGroup> getAutoScalingGroupsWithTag(com.amazonaws.services.autoscaling.model.Tag tag)
        Get list of AutoScalingGroups for a given tag
        Parameters:
        tag - Tag to filter the auto scaling groups
        Returns:
        List of AutoScalingGroups qualifying the filter tag

        Get list of EC2 Instances for a auto scaling group
        Parameters:
        groupName - Auto scaling group name
        status - Instance status (eg. running)
